The user completes the submission of the form
i want to check if we can upload a video more then 60 seconds long

Hey Rony! Yes, you can upload videos longer than 60 seconds. However, it's recommended to keep videos between 15-30 seconds for better engagement. If you want to run longer videos, consider driving users to a Video Sales Letter (VSL). For more details, you can check out our best practices guide here: [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing).
im not sure how can i upload 2min video

No worries, Rony! To upload a 2-minute video, you can follow these steps:
1. Go to your ad creation platform.
2. Select the option to create a new ad or edit an existing one.
3. Choose the video format and upload your 2-minute video file.
4. Make sure to separate it into different ad sets if you're testing different formats (e.g., 9x16 and 16x9).
5. Once uploaded, review and finalize your ad settings before publishing.
For more detailed instructions, you can refer to our guide on creating video ads here: [How to create a video ad](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/19294845964045-How-to-create-a-video-ad).
its saying i can upload only up to 60 seconds video

I see, Rony. It looks like there might be a restriction on the platform you're using. Could you please let me know which platform or service you are using to upload your video? This will help me provide more specific guidance.
